pages.text: Page 1 of 3 National Transportation Safety Board Aviation Accident Factual Report Location: Chevroux, France Accident Number: DEN08WA042 Date & Time: 12/17/2007, 1045 UTC  Registration: Aircraft: Reims F172 M Aircraft Damage: Destroyed Defining Event: Injuries: 1 Fatal Flight Conducted Under: Non-U.S., Non-Commercial On December 17, 2007, at 1045 coordinated universal time, a Reims F172 M, French registered  FBVIF, owned by Airclub Besancon la Veze and piloted by the accident pilot, was destroyed  when it impacted terrain under unknown circumstances near Chevroux, France. A postimpact  fire ensued. Instrument meteorological conditions prevailed at the time of the accident. The  pilot was fatally injured. The flight originated from Chalon (LFLH) and was en route to Bourg  (LFHS), France. The French investigators reported that the airplane collided with the ground in "bad weather  conditions." The accident investigation is under the jurisdiction and control of theFrench government. This  report is for informational purposes only and contains only information released by or  obtained from the French government or the French Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau.  Further information pertaining to this accident may be obtained from:  Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau Bureau d'Enquêtes et d'Analyses Zone Sud 200 rue de Paris Aêroport du Bourget 93350 Le Bourget Cedex France
